news.title: Trump administration moves to remove millions of student loan borrowers from payment pause
news.description: The Trump administration announced a proposed joint settlement with Missouri that would soon force millions of student loan borrowers into repayment.

news.title: OpenAI hires Slack CEO Denise Dresser to lead global revenue strategy
news.description: Dresser was named Slack's chief executive in 2023 after spending more than a decade at Salesforce.

news.title: China is buying U.S. soybeans again — but falling short of goal set by Trump trade agreement
news.description: A trade war begun by President Donald Trump early in his second term led China to halt its purchases of American soybeans.

news.title: Vietnam's stock market is booming in 2025. Why this may just be the beginning
news.description: Move over, China. There's one country that has appeared to become a more attractive investment on Wall Street.

news.title: Bill Gates on why AI will become 'hyper competitive'
news.description: The billionaire philanthropist and Microsoft cofounder said he saw AI changing lives for the better, despite some overvaluations.

news.title: Nvidia can sell the more advanced H200 AI chip to China — but will Beijing want them?
news.description: Nvidia received the green light from the U.S. to sell its advanced H200 chip to China. But there are questions over whether Beijing will allow this to happen.

news.title: Ray-Ban maker EssilorLuxottica falls 5.7% after Google plans AI glasses launch; Europe markets close lower
news.description: European shares ended lower on Tuesday as global investors await the U.S. Federal Reserve's monetary policy update.

news.title: Nvidia gets the OK from Trump to sell chips to China. Is it a reason to buy the stock?
news.description: There's enough in Nvidia's green light from the Trump administration to sell chips in China to add to Wall Street's confidence in the stock.

news.title: Trump's blessing of Nvidia AI chip sales to China gets a chilly reception from GOP
news.description: Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping "responded positively" to the proposal to let Nvidia sell H200 AI chips on condition that the U.S. gets 25% of revenue.

news.title: Instacart's AI pricing tools drive up the cost of some groceries, study finds
news.description: Federal regulators and politicians have scrutinized companies' use of AI tools to set the cost of products or services, often called "surveillance pricing."

news.title: Pfizer adds to obesity bet with up to $2.1 billion deal to develop Chinese company's pill
news.description: The deal will help Pfizer beef up and diversify its obesity drug pipeline following its $10 billion acquisition of obesity biotech Metsera last month.

news.title: Judge unseals Ghislaine Maxwell grand jury materials, citing Epstein files act
news.description: Jeffrey Epstein, a former friend of President Donald Trump, killed himself in jail in August 2019, weeks after being arrested on child sex trafficking charges.

news.title: Bessent says U.S. will finish the year with 3% GDP growth, sees 'very strong' holiday season
news.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the economy will end the year on strong footing and said the president was disappointed in economic coverage in the media.

news.title: Core inflation rate watched by Fed hit 2.8%, delayed September data shows, lower than expected
news.description: The delayed core personal consumption expenditures price index for September was expected to show a 2.9% annual increase.

news.title: Layoff announcements top 1.1 million this year, the most since 2020 pandemic, Challenger says
news.description: The firm said layoff plans totaled  71,321 in November, a step down from October but still enough to bring the 2025 total up to 1.17 million.

news.title: Ukraine, trade, pandas: What China's Xi and France's Macron discussed in Beijing
news.description: China said it is open to importing more high-quality goods from France while urging a "fair, conducive environment" for Chinese businesses in the European nation.

news.title: Bessent says Trump admin will be able to replicate tariffs even if it loses Supreme Court decision
news.description: The Treasury secretary cited several sections of 1962 Trade Act that give the president sweeping powers over import duties.

news.title: November private payrolls unexpectedly fell by 32,000, led by steep small business job cuts, ADP reports
news.description: The payrolls decline marked a sharp step down from October, which saw an upwardly revised gain of 47,000 positions.

news.title: Cramer sees any Nvidia sales of H200s in China as a 'pure bonus,' says the stock should be higher
news.description: Wall Street fails to see the benefit of Nvidia finally getting the green light from the U.S. to sell its second-best chips in China.

news.title: Cramer: I may need to reevaluate our Costco position. Plus, a good sign for Linde
news.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

news.title: Fifth Third signs deal making fintech firm Brex the provider of its commercial cards
news.description: The move shows how some banks are choosing to partner with fintech firms rather than building their own platforms to keep up with evolving tech expectations.

news.title: Ukraine at 'critical moment' in war as European allies ramp up pressure on Russia
news.description: "We all know that the destiny of this country is the destiny of Europe," German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said.

news.title: House Democrats establish AI working group as industry bolsters DC presence
news.description: House lawmakers see the commission as a starting point for working with industry on AI policies, issues.

news.title: Trump threatens Mexico with 5% tariff increase over water dispute
news.description: President Donald Trump on Monday threatened to impose an additional 5% tariff on Mexico if it doesn't immediately provide additional water to help U.S. farmers.
